title: Jess Eva reveals her daughter Matilda nearly died in a drowning accident
text:
The Block's Jess Eva has revealed her two-year-old daughter Matilda nearly died as a result of a drowning accident.

Explaining her recent absence from Triple M's Moonman in the Morning, Jess told listeners on Thursday she'd been through a traumatic personal experience.

'I thought that I had lost my daughter,' said the 34-year-old mother-of-two.

Traumatic: The Block's Jess Eva revealed on Thursday that her two-year-old daughter Matilda nearly died as a result of a drowning accident. Pictured on Triple M's Moonman in the Morning

Jess explained that she had received a distressing phone call on Monday from her partner Norm, who was on holiday in Queensland with Matilda and their five-year-old son Fred.

Norm told her they were on their way to hospital because Matilda had almost drowned in a resort swimming pool.

Jess said the incident happened after Norm had taken his eyes of Matilda for a few seconds while speaking to a friend, before losing sight of her.

Accident: Jess explained that she had received a distressing phone call on Monday from her partner Norm, who told her Matilda was on her way to hospital after almost drowning

Luckily, Norm's friend found Matilda struggling in the water and dived in to save her.

'She was still conscious but she was vomiting, she had foam coming out of her mouth and then she went into a deep sleep,' Jess explained.

Doctors later said Matilda had a build-up of water in her lungs which caused difficulty breathing, otherwise known as 'secondary drowning'.

Ordeal: Doctors later said Matilda had a build-up of water in her lungs which caused difficulty breathing, otherwise known as 'secondary drowning'. Pictured: Jess with her children, Fred and Matilda, and her mother

Becoming visibly emotional in the studio, Jess added: 'Just to think of her underwater and that she was alone... it's just something I didn't want to hear.'

After Norm's panicked phone call, she caught the next flight out of Sydney.

By the time she arrived in Queensland, however, Matilda was doing much better thanks to the care of the doctors and nurses.

Jess emphasised to listeners that Norm was not at fault, saying: 'He feels so terrible. It can happen to anybody.'
description: The Block's Jess Eva has revealed her two-year-old daughter Matilda nearly died as a result of a drowning accident.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
